item.title: Making regression tables with R and Stargazer
item.description: You can find the CPI2006 dataset and R-script used in this post here One large advantage of using R over other statistical software programs, is that its open-source community gets to develop packages to add to R’s basic functionalities. One package which is particularly helpful is the “stargazer” package, which produces beautiful (regression) tables in HTML and LaTeX format. Suppose we take the 2006 Corruption Perception Index (CPI) data which we downloaded in this post and create some tables with stargazer.
